text: William Whitney Pursell (June 9, 1926 â€“ September 3, 2020) was an American composer and session pianist. He wrote the top ten hit "Our Winter Love". He was born in Oakland, California. His follow-up single "Loved" reached Billboard position 121. Pursell later recorded for Epic, Henry Stone's Alston, and Dot, but never hit the pop charts again. He taught at Belmont University. Pursell died of COVID-19 on September 3, 2020 in Nashville, Tennessee. He was 94 years old. ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Tennessee Category:American composers Category:American pianists Category:Educators from Oakland, California Category:Musicians from Oakland, California
title: Bill Pursell
